 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֶ֫תֶר‎</span> **noun [masculine]** ==natron==, or carbonate of soda, a mineral alkali (Late Hebrew = Biblical Hebrew; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נִתְרָא‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; compare Greek <span class="bdbLangGreek">νίτρον</span>, <span class="bdbLangGreek">λίτρον</span>, Latin <abbr title="transliteration"><u>nitrum</u></abbr> (see Lexicons)); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִםתְּֿכַבְּסִי בַּנֶּתֶר‎</span> [[Jer.2.22|Jer 2:22]] though thou wash thyself with ***natron*** (figurative; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בֹּרִית‎</span>; on use of 'nitrum' for handwashing among Greeks see Meineke<sup>Fragm. Comicorum ii. 638</sup>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֹמֶץ עַלנָֿ֑תֶר‎</span> [[Prov.25.20|Prov 25:20]] (figurative of the incompatible).
